X.translation[0].definitions[0].definiti: the 24th letter of the English alphabet
X.translation[0].definitions[1].definiti: the number 10 in the system of roman numerals
X.translation[0].definitions[2].definiti: a letter used in mathematics to represent an unknown quantity or value
X.translation[0].definitions[3].definiti: a mark used on school work to show that a written answer is not correct
X.translation[0].definitions[4].definiti: a mark used to show that you have chosen something on an official piece of paper, for example when voting
X.translation[0].definitions[5].definiti: a mark used to show a kiss, especially at the end of a letter
X.translation[0].definitions[6].definiti: used in the past to describe a film that was officially approved as only suitable for people over 18
X.translation[0].definitions[7].definiti: a letter used instead of someone’s or something’s real name because you want to keep it secret or you do not know it
X.translation[0].definitions[7].example[: At the trial, Ms X said that she had known the defendant for three years.
